com.ftdi.j2xx.interfaces

Interface SpiSlave

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FT_4222_Spi_Slave

    public interface SpiSlave

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getRxStatus(int[] pRxSize)
      Get number of bytes in the receive queue.
      int init()
      Initialize the deivce as SPI slave.
      int read(byte[] buffer, int bufferSize, int[] sizeOfRead)
      Get number of bytes in the receive queue.
      int reset()
      Reset the SPI slave device.

      Write data to the transmit queue of the SPI slave device.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        int init()
        Initialize the deivce as SPI slave.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • getRxStatus

        int getRxStatus(int[] pRxSize)
        Get number of bytes in the receive queue.
        Parameters:
        iSpiIdx - number of bytes in the receive queue.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • read

        int read(byte[] buffer,
       int bufferSize,
       int[] sizeOfRead)
        Get number of bytes in the receive queue.
        Parameters:
        buffer - buffer that receives the data from the device.
        bufferSize - number of bytes to read from the device.
        sizeOfRead - number of bytes read from the device.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • write

        int write(byte[] buffer,
        int bufferSize,
        int[] sizeTransferred)
        Write data to the transmit queue of the SPI slave device.
        Parameters:
        buffer - buffer that contains the data to be written to the device.
        bufferSize - number of bytes to read from the device.
        sizeTransferred - number of bytes written to the device.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • reset

        int reset()
        Reset the SPI slave device.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.
